Democrat Alisha Shelton has officially filed to run for the U.S. Senate, becoming only the second black woman in Nebraska history to seek the office! This comes during Black History Month, where Shelton is making history as the first black woman to run for the seat in Nebraska in some 40 years. In 1976, Lenore Etchison was the first  first woman of color to run for U.S. Senate in Nebraska. Etchison ran again in 1978. ‚ÄúAs a resident of Omaha, I see a need for Nebraska‚Äôs senators to reflect the population they represent and their Nebraska values,‚Äù Shelton said. ‚ÄúShelton‚Äôs platform includes: reducing gun violence, making quality healthcare accessible, strengthening trade and agriculture and mitigating climate change.‚Äù Read more: https://nebraskademocrats.org/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/Shelton-Press-Release.pdf

Proud to be a U.S. Senate candidate (Nebraska) alongside Jaime Harrison. He has an amazing story that inspires me to work harder. Thank you for sharing with us & highlighting the strength of Black women. I will win! #SCPrimary #DrainTheGasOutofSasse #SheltonforSenate #FlipTheSenate
Thank you Jim Clyburn  I heard everything you said.  I will continue to work hard to #DrainTheGasOutofSasse #SheltonforSenate #FlipTheSenate #SCPrimary

Team Shelton! I usually don‚Äôt address bullies. However let me be clear since other candidates are saying I am being shown special treatment from NDP because I am Black.  The person in this race with me who  is posting that ‚Äúfavoritism‚Äù got me to South Carolina has clearly under estimated the reach and power of my sorority. All the events I attended yesterday were organized by members of Delta Sigma Theta who work in the political sector with the democratic party locally and nationally.  Some of them even spoke at the First in the South dinner. These events were planned surrounding the Congressional Black Caucus hosting the debate to support candidates that look like me. Wait am I be attacked for getting support from people who look like me? I was glad when Jane Kleeb notified all of the Senate candidates because I am a transparent leader. House members shared great strategies that apply to Nebraskans and tips on overcoming  obstacles a person of color faces in politics. Lastly, when I shared that I was entering the race at a vendor fest held by NDP. They told me ‚ÄúOh s***, if I knew a Black woman would be entering this race I wouldn‚Äôt be in it. ‚Äú Yet, I‚Äôve heard a beautifully fabricated story about them being glad another women is in the race.  When people show you who they are believe them, I know exactly who they are. Thanks for showing me more than once! I am staying the course to #DrainTheGasOutofSasse and will not focus on anymore distractions.
First in the South Dinner! Gullah Music by the Magnolia Band.

Blessed to attend #BlackWomenontheRoad 2020 and feel all the magic preparing for the #SCPrimary. #SeatAtTheTable #DrainTheGasOutofSasse #SheltonforSenate #FlipTheSenate

This is State Senator Adam Morfeld. I first met Senator Morfeld when he worked at Nebraska Appleseed. He was the first person to teach me how to testify on a bill and the points to address when doing so. At a Delta Days at the Unicameral one year, he was instrumental in providing tips to stop the voter ID bill around 2010. Senator Morfeld is informed and has a heart for people. Trust me Nebraska, as a clinician  you do not want to look in the eyes of a  wife, a mother, a husband, or even a child when they plead to you that they tried to get help for their family member but since they never said the ‚Äúright‚Äù words no one intervened. Right here in Nebraska we‚Äôve had people end their life with their own guns. Clinician‚Äôs understand that suicide is impulsive, not planned over several months. It takes one weak moment and as a responsible gun owner I know how procedural pulling a trigger can become. I am deeply saddened that Senator Morfeld‚Äôs life was threatened when he and so many others at the Unicameral are working so hard for US! Great job Senator Morfeld. It‚Äôs taken me an entire day to get my thoughts together. You did not deserve this and you have more supporters than you know.

Thank you to the NDP Black Caucus for allowing me to speak at your meeting. I heard great information and the timing was perfect for me to introduce myself to nearby community meetings. We are all ready to #DrainTheGasOutofSasse #SheltonforSenate #FlipTheSenate

Every child I‚Äôve counseled in 2019 fears this. Their level of Anxiety and PTSD is detrimental to their development. It‚Äôs time to #DrainTheGasOutofSasse #SheltonforSenate #FlipTheSenate #EndGunViolence
Thank you Empowerment Network for being so welcoming at your meeting and providing great information.  It's time to #DrainTheGasOutofSasse #SheltonforSenate #FlipTheSenate
Thank you Nebraska Young Democrats for such an amazing dinner! Inspiration was everywhere. We are ready to #DrainTheGasOutofSasse  #SheltonforSenate #FlipTheSenate

As it is fitting during Black History Month, I want to highlight a Black history first. I am so thankful that a Nebraskan spoke up to clarify history. I am actually the 2nd woman of color to run for U.S. Senate. Lenore Etchison ran in 1976.  She is the first person of color & African American woman to run for U.S. Senate. Why don‚Äôt we talk about her? We should #SayHerName too! I am sure HERstory is amazing. I am proud to continue her journey as Delta Sigma Theta Sorority, Inc and Xavier University of Louisiana has taught me to do. My goal is to become the democratic nominee from your votes on May 12th. I stand with integrity, Nebraskan values, and each jewel you‚Äôve shared with me. Your stories will stay in my heart and inspire me to fight for the good life. We all matter Nebraskans. I am listening. Together we will win!  #DrainTheGasOutofSasse #StandForSomething #BlackHistory #SheltonforSenate

On this 6th day of Black History Month, I am honored to be the first African American Woman and the first Woman of Color to run for U.S. Senate in Nebraska! I was blessed with a great education from Xavier University of Louisiana  that equipped me to be in the "room where it happens" as sung in the Hamilton musical.  Delta Sigma Theta Sorority, Inc  influenced me to develop the DNA of our Sorors Shirley Chisholm, Representative Marcia L. Fudge and Loretta Lynch.  Trailblazing is in my blood, I will maintain my integrity and be  #unbosseDST. I have the courage to #DriveEmCrazy. It is time #DrainTheGasOutofSasse. Donate today to help me #FlipTheSenate at   https://secure.actblue.com/donate/sheltonforsenate

I heard various opinions about the State of the Union address. For years we as Americans learned to love our neighbors. In times of despair we come together. That doesn‚Äôt change because someone made a speech. The President does not have control of your mind. Exercise your power with your vote. Become a block captain, ensure everyone you know is registered to vote. Now more than ever, every vote matters...especially yours. #DrainTheGasOutofSasse #SheltonforSenate
Thank you for the video Sir Night Photography!Check out Alisha Shelton from this past Saturday meeting of the Buffalo County Democrats. Alisha Shelton

It was so great to meet Ann Ashford for Congress  while supporting Best Burger. I had a great veggie burger with the best black beans and spices and a wonderful conversation with a wonderful woman! #WomenWhoRun #SheltonforSente #DrainTheGasOutOfSasseGreat things happening at the Best Burger. Pop Up. Phenomenal food, great service and I got to meet and have a long chat with the amazing Alisha Shelton, candidate for Senate. Can't wait for the permanent Best Burger location at the end of March. #NE02

Today, I listened to some great people in Unadilla, NE at the 32nd Annual Groundhog Day Celebration. When asked who currently holds the seat I am running for I told them my goal is to #DrainTheGasOutofSasse and many expressed their frustrations with a Senator who voted for no witnesses, had zero town halls, and sent a guy to drive his bus in their parade.   There is still unity in our great state. We all want to be heard. Thank you for the many conversations Unadilla! I will do my best to return in June for the BBQ!  #SheltonforSenate #FlipTheSenate

I cannot let the day go by without sharing why #ILovePublicSchools . My time at Omaha Burke High School made attending Xavier University of Louisiana a very smooth transition. The curriculum, challenging AP courses, and teachers who cared enough to help me after school enhanced my sense of community.  It influenced a young girl in the world who had no clue how to apply to a college. Every teacher, administrator, school nurse, maintenance, janitor, bus driver, security guard, coach, and staff is an integral piece of a carefully woven team. They speak love to our students daily. Thank you Public Schools for all that you do!!!

Nebraskans if you have not called your U.S. Senators considering taking the time to do so. You have the right to be heard. We deserve answers.  #DraintheGasOutofSasseCall or email Sens. Ben Sasse and Deb Fischer and demand that we hear from the multiple first-hand witnesses who have potentially critical information about Trump‚Äôs abuse of power, but were blocked by Trump from participating in the House inquiry. Fischer: (202) 224-6551 Email: www.fischer.senate.gov/public/index.cfm/contact Sasse: (202) 224-4224 Email www.sasse.senate.gov/public/index.cfm/email-ben We need to hear from Mick Mulvaney, John Bolton, top Mulvaney aide Robert Blair, OMB associate director Michael Duffey and others. We also need to see documents that are directly relevant to the charges.

text: Candidate Forum
I am  eager to hear from Nebraskans! York County, thank you so much for the invitation. #SheltonforSenate #DrainTheGasOutofSasse

Every action has a reaction.  Help me #DrainTheGasOutofSasse and bring Nebraskan values to the U.S. Senate. You can sign up on this page to volunteer or go to SheltonforSenate.com and donate.  https://metro.newschannelnebraska.com/story/41532879/sasse-ripped-by-fellow-gop-senator
#Sheltonites I will be sharing information at Indivisible Nebraska‚Äôs Public meeting. Join us!  https://facebook.com/events/s/indivisible-nebraska-public-gr/469416043757622/?ti=icl

Happy New Year, now you‚Äôre seeing 20/20! What a blessing to have vision. Thank you everyone for donating to my campaign and signing up to volunteer! I am ready to stand with you and address your concerns on the U.S. Senate floor. We have exciting events occurring this month. Stay tuned for more information! 1925 Society #DST #XULA

Today I attended the 13th Annual Community Kwanzaa Luncheon Celebration. I heard a call to put Kwanzaa principles into practice. As I reflected on Kujichagulia, which means self-determination and is the 2nd principle; I am reminded of the many calls to action I‚Äôve heard over the years. A call to participate in E.I.E and stop gun violence, a call to register voters, a call to boycott voter suppression, a call to boycott our lack of healthcare, and a recent call that changed my life. A call that rose from deep within me, a call that remembered Payton Benson who was shot while eating breakfast, a call that reminded me that our Sandy Hook angels would be 13-14 years old today, a call to run for U.S. Senate and make your problems MY problems. As we close out this month ending our last quarter, if you feel a call to participate please donate to my campaign. We are just $3,000 shy of our goal. Can you contribute $25, $50, $100, or more by December 31st? Join my team and help us take Nebraskan values to the U.S. Senate. Donate at: https://secure.actblue.com/donate/sheltonforsenate

Thank you Nebraska Democratic Party,  Terrell McKinney LD11, and Cross Cuts for creating such a phenomenal opportunity with Shop Talk! I had a wonderful time  discussing Nebraskan values and current issues. I am grateful for the chance to listen to the heart of every person there. I heard you and I see you Nebraska. You truly have solid options for U.S. Senate. I look forward to more events where I will clearly display to all Nebraskans why I want to take the #GasOutofSasse and #FlipTheSenate

I attended the Black & Gold Pink Ice Ball at the Double Tree in Omaha yesterday. This is a collaboration with the first black fraternity Alpha Phi Alpha founded in 1906, and the first black sorority Alpha Kappa Alpha founded in 1908. They graciously invited me to introduce myself and announce why I am running for U.S. Senate. It was a phenomenal event and I am so grateful for the opportunity. Thank you for the invitation!
‚ÄúVote because it‚Äôs your right. Vote for me because I‚Äôm the right choice.‚Äù -Alisha Shelton, Shop Talk.

Thank you to all who have donated the week before Christmas! I am so grateful for your support. You continue to help the campaign grow and build momentum.  We are so close to our weekly goal and are in need of your fiscal support this week. Can you donate any amount by Saturday at 11 PM EST? With your support we can #FlipTheSenate! https://secure.actblue.com/donate/sheltonforsenate

Commitment is the next skill I‚Äôd like to highlight. I am loyal to what I start and any task I take on. I learned the true definition of service from my brother as he served our country and retired in the United States Army. Service in Delta Sigma Theta has taught me how to register voters, identify legislators, and be a voice for the voiceless. When you truly serve our country, you represent all your constituents regardless of their party affiliation. My commitment to you will be relentless! #SheltonforSenate #YouMatter
Excited for Shop Talk next Saturday December 21st. I look forward to listening to our community members. #dst #xula #1925Society #FlipTheSenate

A skill that I have perfected through my profession is active listening. As I travel to Winnebago, NE from Omaha, NE and interact with many of you on the road or out in the community, it's clear that we all hold the same values.  You are not a number to me, you are person. I see you, I hear you, and I will bring our values to the U.S. Senate.  #FliptheSenate #VoteBlue #TalktoMe

I attended the 9th Annual Christmas in the Village yesterday, a wonderful community celebration hosted by the Empowerment Network. It's simply amazing how many members of our community stopped to ask me questions and how they can help my campaign. It was great to catch up with so many people. I remember every story shared because it is a piece of you, a jewel you chose to give and I will never forget it.  Here is the donation link. We are just shy of our goal. Can you donate $5, $15, $25 or more to join our movement to #FliptheSenate . We are bringing all of these jewels to the Senate! https://secure.actblue.com/donate/sheltonforsenate

Thank you, thank you, thank you for all of your support! The page likes, the donations, and volunteer signup have been so amazing this first week!  If you have not had a chance, can you donate via this link to help us meet our very first deadline tomorrow?  We are so close and any amount helps.  https://secure.actblue.com/donate/sheltonforsenate

Thank you for all of the likes to this page and for all of your donations! Your support is amazing and  I strive to carry your voices all the way to Washington D.C.  I  received a question about why campaigns must fundraise from the public. All campaigns must pay for their own marketing materials, commercials/ads, a campaign location, and various services. There is a limit to the amount a candidate can donate to their campaign, which makes it impossible for one person to fund their entire campaign. I want to be a voice for Nebraskans not a voice for large corporations to push hidden agendas in exchange for a corporate donation.  Here is the donation link.  https://secure.actblue.com/donate/sheltonforsenate Can you donate $15, $25, or more and/or sign up to support via the Sign up button on this page. This will help us hit our goal for this week! Thank you for taking a chance on this strong-willed Nebraskan girl!

Happy Saturday! Here is a 7 minute video from the Federal Election Commission that provides vital information about donations.   I strive to represent Nebraskans, not corporations with hidden agendas that seek to buy our democracy.  https://youtu.be/lwgQYQlnc2g

Thank you all for subscribing to this page!  We've received questions from Nebraskans who moved out of our state and voters across the U.S who want to help by donating. Anyone can donate, you do not have to reside in the state of Nebraska. Donations fund our movement to #FliptheSenateBlue. Donate here  https://secure.actblue.com/donate/sheltonforsenate

I‚Äôm a Clinical Supervisor running for the U.S. Senate seat in Nebraska -it‚Äôs currently held by Ben Sasse (R) who endorses Trump. We need your help to Drain the Gas out of Sasse and  #FlipTheSenate. Can you chip in $5, $25, $50 or more by midnight to keep us on track?  Donate now: https://secure.actblue.com/donate/sheltonforsenate

My name is Alisha Shelton and I am running for U.S. Senate. It‚Äôs time that Nebraskans have a clear choice. A person who works for the people instead of corporations. We deserve representation that truly reflects Nebraska values. Economic opportunities across our state, strengthening trade in agriculture, strong families with access to quality healthcare, supporting our teachers, being good stewards of our environment, and fair pay‚Äîare Nebraska values. Join me in this movement, because every Nebraskan deserves a chance. Sign up at sheltonforsenate.com
